Almost 4 weeks
In Germany, they continue to go through a normal asylum procedure.
There are no centers.
If there is no identifiable identity, the whole procedure cannot apply anyway. Only applies to the Eurodac1 group. Are about 5 people a day.

It is an existing legal framework, there are already rejections (12,000 in 2017). This is about alleged unilateral rejections - without the consent of the host country. That does not exist and will not exist.
It is about checking where the asylum procedure is running.
